title: 110_hr1989
content: The Act is titled the "Fort Stanton-Snowy River Cave National Conservation Area Act" and defines terms like Conservation Area and Management Plan. The Secretary of the Interior is responsible for the Conservation Area established by the Act. The Fort Stanton-Snowy River Cave National Conservation Area is established in Lincoln County, New Mexico to protect and enhance the historic, cultural, scientific, archaeological, natural, and educational cave resources. The Conservation Area includes specific boundaries depicted on a map dated January 25, 2007, and the Secretary will submit a map and legal description to Congress for approval. The Conservation Area established in Lincoln County, New Mexico includes specific boundaries depicted on a map dated January 25, 2007. The Secretary may correct minor errors in the map and legal description, which will be available for public inspection. SEC. 4. MANAGEMENT OF THE CONSERVATION AREA. The Secretary is responsible for managing the Conservation Area in a way that conserves, protects, and enhances its resources and values, in accordance with relevant laws. Only uses consistent with cave resource protection are allowed, and conservation and protection of the natural resources are required. The Conservation Area is managed to conserve and protect its natural features for public use, ensure public access while safeguarding cave resources, allow existing or new uses that do not harm its purpose, and follow the Fort Stanton Area of Critical Environmental Concern Final Activity Plan. The Conservation Area is managed to conserve natural features for public use, protect cave resources, and allow research partnerships for scientific investigation and educational services. Federal land within the area is withdrawn from general land and mining laws. The Conservation Area is managed to conserve natural features, protect cave resources, and allow research partnerships. Federal land is withdrawn from general land and mining laws. A comprehensive management plan will be developed within 2 years, incorporating appropriate land use decisions and study information. The Conservation Area in Lincoln County, New Mexico, allows for a cooperative agreement with the local community for interpretation and protection of resources. Activities outside the area are not restricted, and research facilities may be established for scientific research. The Conservation Area in Lincoln County, New Mexico allows for cooperative agreements with the State and other institutions for research and interpretation purposes. The Act does not reserve any water rights. Authorization of appropriations is granted to carry out the Act.
